mainBoard.flavorText:
"From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!"
"Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"
mainBoard.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade

rulings.text: You can activate the ability repeatedly during a turn. This generally has no additional effect, unless some other effect (like that from Adarkar Windform has caused it to lose flying since the last time the ability resolved.

For flying to work as an evasion ability, an attacking Goblin Balloon Brigade’s ability must be activated before the declare blockers step begins. Once Goblin Balloon Brigade has become blocked, giving it flying won’t change that.

mainBoard.text: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!"
"Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"
mainBoard.name: Goblin Digging Team
mainBoard.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back!"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran
mainBoard.name: Goblin Hero

mainBoard.flavorText: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok . . . .
mainBoard.name: Goblin King

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

mainBoard.text: Other Goblins get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk.

mainBoard.name: Goblin Matron

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

If an effect refers to a “[subtype] spell” or “[subtype] card,” it refers only to a spell or card that has that subtype. For example, Goblin War Party is a card that references and creates Goblins, but it isn't a Goblin card.

mainBoard.text: When Goblin Matron enters, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

mainBoard.name: Goblin Mutant
mainBoard.text:
Trample
Goblin Mutant can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater.
Goblin Mutant can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Next!"
mainBoard.name: Goblin Recruiter

rulings.text: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including creature or kindred cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

mainBoard.text: When Goblin Recruiter enters, search your library for any number of Goblin cards, reveal them, then shuffle and put those cards on top in any order.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Strength in numbers? Right."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician
mainBoard.name: Goblin Snowman
mainBoard.text:
Whenever Goblin Snowman blocks, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.
{T}: Goblin Snowman deals 1 damage to target creature it's blocking.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Can they *do* that?"
—Imwita, Zhalfirin artificer, last words
mainBoard.name: Goblin Tinkerer
mainBoard.text: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals damage equal to its mana value to Goblin Tinkerer.

mainBoard.name: Goblin Vandal

rulings.text: If the defending player controls no artifacts that you can target, the ability doesn’t go on the stack and you can’t pay {R}.

An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

mainBoard.text: Whenever Goblin Vandal attacks and isn't blocked, you may pay {R}. If you do, destroy target artifact defending player controls and Goblin Vandal assigns no combat damage this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: "I got it! I got it! I—"
mainBoard.name: Mogg Fanatic

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it’s too late to activate its ability before it’s destroyed.

mainBoard.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.
mainBoard.name: Mogg Flunkies

rulings.text: Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, other attacking creatures don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don't have to block the same creature that Mogg Flunkies blocks.
If an effect says that Mogg Flunkies attacks or blocks if able and you control another creature able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Mogg Flunkies and that creature.
If you control more than one Mogg Flunkies, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.
Once Mogg Flunkies has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.

mainBoard.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.

mainBoard.flavorText: The evisceration of one mogg always cheers up the rest.
mainBoard.name: Mogg Raider
mainBoard.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Charging alone takes uncommong daring or uncommon stupidity. Or both.
mainBoard.name: Raging Goblin
mainBoard.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh
'n da hurt'll disappear."
—Troll chant
mainBoard.name: Uthden Troll
mainBoard.text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.

mainBoard.flavorText: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.
mainBoard.name: Volcanic Dragon
mainBoard.text: Flying, haste

mainBoard.flavorText: "Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight."
mainBoard.name: Black Knight
mainBoard.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

mainBoard.name: Cuombajj Witches

rulings.text: Even though the opponent chooses a target, you control the ability. An opponent can't target a creature they control with hexproof.
You choose which opponent chooses the second target. It doesn't have to be the opponent who controls (or is) the first target.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to any target of an opponent's choice.

mainBoard.name: Hypnotic Specter

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter’s damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Ihsan, the weak. Ihsan, the fallen. Ihsan, the betrayer. He has brought shame to the Serra Paladins where none existed before. May his suffering equal his betrayal."
—Baris, Serra Inquisitor
mainBoard.name: Ihsan's Shade
mainBoard.text: Protection from white

mainBoard.name: Knight of Stromgald
mainBoard.text:
Protection from white
{B}: Knight of Stromgald gains first strike until end of turn.
{B}{B}: Knight of Stromgald gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone."
—A wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca
mainBoard.name: Lady Orca

mainBoard.flavorText:
"A fine example of the rewards of artifice: a thoroughly obedient steed with wings of Soldevi steel."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
mainBoard.name: Aesthir Glider
mainBoard.text:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.

mainBoard.name: Fireball

rulings.text: Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.

For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its mana value is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"I don't suppose we could teach them to throw the cursed things?"
—Ivra Jursdotter
mainBoard.name: Goblin Grenade

rulings.text: You can't sacrifice more than one Goblin to get a greater effect.
Players can only respond once Goblin Grenade has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try and destroy the Goblin to prevent you from casting Goblin Grenade.
The Goblin you sacrifice to cast Goblin Grenade doesn't have to be a creature. For example, you could sacrifice Boggart Shenanigans (a kindred enchantment with the subtype Goblin).

mainBoard.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a Goblin.
Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to any target.

mainBoard.flavorText: They certainly are.
mainBoard.name: Goblin Offensive

rulings.text: The tokens are named "Goblin Token" and have the creature type "Goblin."

mainBoard.text: Create X 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—*Sarpadian Empires*, vol. IV
mainBoard.name: Goblin Warrens

rulings.text: The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

mainBoard.text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.

mainBoard.name: Lightning Bolt
mainBoard.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

mainBoard.name: Pyrokinesis

rulings.text: Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis doesn’t resolve.

mainBoard.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."
—Navajo war chant
mainBoard.name: Pyrotechnics

rulings.text: If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can’t be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics’s targets become illegal, you can’t change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn’t dealt.
You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

mainBoard.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Could there be a fouler act? No doubt the baron knows of one."
—Autumn Willow

Enchanted creature gets +4/+0.

mainBoard.name: Nevinyrral's Disk

rulings.text: You don't sacrifice Nevinyrral's Disk to activate its ability. It's destroyed as part of the ability's resolution if it's still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral's Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
